thread.title: Warriors players wear cupcake T-shirts in final troll of Thunder | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Warriors players wear cupcake T-shirts in final troll of Thunder | NBA | Sporting News

author: Zac Al-Khateeb
title: Warriors players wear cupcake T-shirts in final troll of Thunder | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 11, 2017 11:55pm EST February 11, 2017 11:55pm EST The Warriors didn't start the cupcake fight, but boy did they finish it. CupcakeKD (Getty Images) 
Published on Feb. 11, 2017 
Updated at 11:55 p.m. ET 
The Warriors didn't start this cupcake war with the Thunder, but they finished it emphatically after their 130-114 win in Oklahoma City. 
Scorned Thunder fans wore cupcake-themed T-shirts (an homage to a Russell Westbrook dig at Kevin Durant ) to get under KD's skin in his OKC homecoming; one fan even dressed up as CupcakeKD to really push it over the top. 
How did the Warriors respond? By wearing those exact same T-shirts in postgame, of course. Draymond Green wearing a cupcake shirt pic.twitter.com/CSvqxl3nKj — Tim Cato (@tim_cato) February 12, 2017 
Golden State forward Draymond Green — who scored six points and pulled down eight rebounds on Saturday — explained the fashion statement in a postgame interview with ESPN: 
"From my perspective, it's about a guy on our team who's a cupcake. But since he came out and completely crushed a cupcake, then I'm supporting the cupcake," Green said. "It's not a compliment. It's actually pretty disrespectful. But when you come out and do what he did tonight, and kind of silence all that noise, I'm rocking with it." 
Durant scored a team-high 34 points and nine rebounds in the game — some cupcake. Watch This
